intro: Sisymbrium pakistanicum, commonly known as the Pakistan mustard, is an annual herbaceous plant native to South Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils. Its seeds are often used in traditional medicine and as a spice in local cuisines. Sisymbrium pakistanicum is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits in supporting pollinators.
